title: Investors Emerge From Havens as Trade Outlook Brightens — Market Talk
text:
11:22 ET - Hopes for progress on trade talks between the US and China are bringing investors out of haven assets and into riskier plays. The yen, a popular destination for nervous investors, is down around 0.5% against the dollar and at its lowest level against the US currency since August. Gold is off 1.5%, while the Swiss franc and US government bonds are also selling off. Emerging market currencies, which have been hurt by trade fears in recent months, are mostly higher. So are U.S stocks, with the S&P up 1.6%. (ira.iosebashvili@wsj.com)

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 11, 2019 11:40 ET (15:40 GMT)
